body.p:
Litchfield Ky Oct 20th 1863
Mr John Boyle Esq

Sir I noticed an order in the Louisville Journal you directting Some friend to his county to assist Some in this order which you had issued for each county to raise one company of men as State vol and you wishing Some person to Send on for a Lieu Col or Col Ship in some county I wish the Commision of the Lieu Col as to my military capacities I was first a Capt in the State or home Guards and I received my Comission from Gen McCook get camp Nevin in Hardon Co Ky. in Oct 1861 and I dun all in my power ever since that time to put down this rebellio and on the 7th of last July I was appointed as Enrooling Officer of Grayson Co and I completed my work and since that time I have been dept prov mar in the 2nd dist of Ky
as to refrences you may apply to Judge D Wortham the Judge of Grayson Co to Lieut Ferry of the 17th Ky Vol Lieut A R Byers in the 35 Ky vol Q. M T. R. Mcbath of 27 Ky vol & Capt John. h. Grissom prov mar of 2nd Dist Ky you will please give me an answer to my letter whether on or not I am granted the Commission

Gov. Thomas E. Bramlette
Thomas E. Bramlette
Grayson Coy Oct 20/63

Stephen G Crawford Lt Col
